title: Tatsuya Mochizuki
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and manager.
Playing career.
Mochizuki was born in <a href="Shizuoka%20%28city%29">Shizuoka</a> on April 20, 1963. After graduating from <a href="Shimizu%20Higashi%20High%20School">Shimizu Higashi High School</a>, he played professionally in the Netherlands, for <a href="HFC%20Haarlem">Haarlem</a> and <a href="SC%20Telstar">Telstar</a> between 1982 and 1986. In 1986, he moved back to Japan to play for <a href="J%C3%BAbilo%20Iwata">Yamaha Motors</a>, which later became <a href="J%C3%BAbilo%20Iwata">Júbilo Iwata</a>.
Coaching career.
After retiring, Mochizuki began his coaching career and held several positions with the <a href="J%C3%BAbilo%20Iwata">Júbilo Iwata</a> organization before leaving in 2002 to become the coach of <a href="Avispa%20Fukuoka">Avispa Fukuoka</a>'s youth team. He was selected to be the manager of <a href="Vegalta%20Sendai">Vegalta Sendai</a>, in the <a href="J.League">J.League</a> beginning in the <a href="2007%20J.League%20Division%202">2007 season</a>. However, Sendai failed to return to Division 1 and he resigned from the job after the season. He has previously served as a coach of Vegalta, <a href="Shonan%20Bellmare">Shonan Bellmare</a>, and Avispa Fukuoka and also filled in as interim manager at each of those three teams.
